sources.data_found: The Distributed Environment for Academic Computing (DEAC) is Wake Forest University's High-Performance Computing (HPC) Cluster. The facility was established in July 2002. The cluster supports general-purpose GPU computing. Image shows 'Inside a cluster GPU node.'
NVIDIA 480GTX GPUs donated by NVIDIA, Inc. Built by Wake Forest University Computer Science Dept. student volunteers.
Last year, this centralized HPC system processed over 21 million core-hours from more than 650,000 tasks that were submitted by Wake Forest researchers.
17 Total Graduate Students; Male (94%) Female (5%); 12 Total faculty
Computer Science is the fastest growing major at Wake Forest, having grown from 18 total declarations in 2015 to 59 in 2025. That's a 228% growth rate.
There are 9,121 students including 5,471 undergraduate and 3,650 graduate students at Wake Forest University for the academic year 2023-2024.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count from Wake Forest admissions page showing 59 CS major declarations in 2025. Graduate CS count from Peterson's showing 17 total graduate students in Computer Science department. PhD count not found as Wake Forest CS offers only BS and MS degrees, no PhD program.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Mentioned on CS department research page as donated by NVIDIA, Inc. Built by WFU CS student volunteers. Exact count not specified.

gpu_resources.notes: Wake Forest operates the DEAC (Distributed Environment for Academic Computing) HPC Cluster established in 2002. The cluster supports general-purpose GPU computing, but specific GPU models and counts are not publicly listed on their HPC pages. Only confirmed GPUs are NVIDIA GTX 480s donated to CS department. The cluster processed over 21 million core-hours in 2021-2022.

analysis_notes: Wake Forest University operates the DEAC HPC Cluster but does not publicly list detailed GPU specifications. CS enrollment is relatively small with 59 undergraduates and 17 graduate students (MS only, no PhD program). Limited public information about GPU resources available.
